actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to retirement benefits for certain employees of the Bureau of Indian Affairs and the Indian Health Service not entitled to Indian preference, provide greater opportunity for advancement and employment of Indians.

summary.text: Provides that a Federal employee is entitled to a civil service annuity if he: (1) is separated from the service after completing 20 years of service; (2) was employed in the Bureau of Indian Affairs or the Indian Health Service continuously from June 17, 1974, to the date of his separation; and (3) is not an Indian entitled to a preference under any provision of law granting a preference to Indians in promotions and other personnel actions.

titles.title: A bill to retirement benefits for certain employees of the Bureau of Indian Affairs and the Indian Health Service not entitled to Indian preference, provide greater opportunity for advancement and employment of Indians.
